question_text: Why do LCD projectors have temperature sensors and automatic shutdown features?
answer_options: To prevent theft of expensive components
To conserve electricity during peak usage hours
To protect the expensive metal halide bulb from overheating damage
To reduce noise from cooling fans in quiet environments
correct_answer: To protect the expensive metal halide bulb from overheating damage
explanation: Temperature sensors monitor the extreme heat from metal halide bulbs (around 1,000Â°C) and trigger automatic shutdown if temperatures become dangerous. This prevents costly bulb damage and potential safety hazards from overheating.
